#summary The basics of GWT development, from installation of the GWT software to a finished application.

=The Basics=

We'll start by covering the basics of GWT development, creating a project from scratch and then incrementally adding features until we have a fully-functional application ready to be deployed to a web server.

After completing these topics, you can continue to the [GettingStartedMore Add More Features] learn about topics like [GettingStartedRPC remote procedure calls] and [GettingStartedI18n internationalization].
  
 * [GettingStartedInstall Install GWT] Install the GWT package and Java SDK

 * [GettingStartedCreateProject Create a GWT Project] Creating a new project for developing !StockWatcher
   
 * [GettingStartedAppDesign Design the Application] A list of requirements for our sample application and the GWT features that will be used to implement it.

 * [GettingStartedUserInterface Create the User Interface] Laying out the visual design and adding user interface components to build.

 * [GettingStartedEvents Add Event Listeners] How to add code that responds to events coming back from the browser.

 * [GettingStartedClientFunc Implement client-side Functionality] Implementing more logic.

 * [GettingStartedHostedMode Debug in Hosted Mode] How to debug using GWT's Development Shell in hosted mode.

 * [GettingStartedStyle Add CSS Styling] Adjust the look and feel of !StockWatcher using stylesheets.

 * [GettingStartedWebMode Deploy] Compile your client-side Java code into !JavaScript using the Java compile and run it in a web browser.

==Next...==

Continue to the next section [GettingStartedInstall Install GWT]
